channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TextRegion: Text-Aligned Region Tokens from Frozen Image-Text Models
item.description: Image-text models excel at image-level tasks but struggle with detailed visual understanding.

item.title: ZPressor: Bottleneck-Aware Compression for Scalable Feed-Forward 3DGS
item.description: Feed-forward 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) models have recently emerged as a promising solution for novel view synthesis, enabling one-pass inference without the need for per-scene 3DGS optimization.

item.title: Self-Correcting Code Generation Using Small Language Models
item.description: In response, we introduce CoCoS, an approach designed to enhance the ability of small language models for multi-turn code correction.

item.title: HyperMotion: DiT-Based Pose-Guided Human Image Animation of Complex Motions
item.description: Recent advances in diffusion models have significantly improved conditional video generation, particularly in the pose-guided human image animation task.

item.title: WebDancer: Towards Autonomous Information Seeking Agency
item.description: We instantiate this framework in a web agent based on the ReAct, WebDancer.

item.title: GoMatching++: Parameter- and Data-Efficient Arbitrary-Shaped Video Text Spotting and Benchmarking
item.description: We believe that GoMatching++ and the ArTVideo benchmark will drive future advancements in video text spotting.

item.title: LoKI: Low-damage Knowledge Implanting of Large Language Models
item.description: Fine-tuning adapts pretrained models for specific tasks but poses the risk of catastrophic forgetting (CF), where critical knowledge from pre-training is overwritten.

item.title: UniTalk: Towards Universal Active Speaker Detection in Real World Scenarios
item.description: We present UniTalk, a novel dataset specifically designed for the task of active speaker detection, emphasizing challenging scenarios to enhance model generalization.

item.title: ChatPD: An LLM-driven Paper-Dataset Networking System
item.description: Scientific research heavily depends on suitable datasets for method validation, but existing academic platforms with dataset management like PapersWithCode suffer from inefficiencies in their manual workflow.

item.title: Shapley Value-driven Data Pruning for Recommender Systems
item.description: To bridge this gap, we propose Shapley Value-driven Valuation (SVV), a framework that evaluates interactions based on their objective impact on model training rather than subjective intent assumptions.

item.title: Fast Isotropic Median Filtering
item.description: Median filtering is a cornerstone of computational image processing.

item.title: RenderFormer: Transformer-based Neural Rendering of Triangle Meshes with Global Illumination
item.description: We present RenderFormer, a neural rendering pipeline that directly renders an image from a triangle-based representation of a scene with full global illumination effects and that does not require per-scene training or fine-tuning.

item.title: Zero-Shot Vision Encoder Grafting via LLM Surrogates
item.description: Vision encoders trained on the surrogate can then be directly transferred to the larger model, a process we call zero-shot grafting -- when plugged directly into the full-size target LLM, the grafted pair surpasses the encoder-surrogate pair and, on some benchmarks, even performs on par with full decoder training with the target LLM.

item.title: VIGNETTE: Socially Grounded Bias Evaluation for Vision-Language Models
item.description: While bias in large language models (LLMs) is well-studied, similar concerns in vision-language models (VLMs) have received comparatively less attention.

item.title: VME: A Satellite Imagery Dataset and Benchmark for Detecting Vehicles in the Middle East and Beyond
item.description: To address this gap, we present the Vehicles in the Middle East (VME) dataset, designed explicitly for vehicle detection in high-resolution satellite images from Middle Eastern countries.

item.title: GeoLLaVA-8K: Scaling Remote-Sensing Multimodal Large Language Models to 8K Resolution
item.description: To address data scarcity, we introduce SuperRS-VQA (avg.

item.title: MLMC-based Resource Adequacy Assessment with Active Learning Trained Surrogate Models
item.description: For large-scale systems, the efficiency gains from surrogate models are often offset by the substantial time required for labeling training data.

item.title: Understand, Think, and Answer: Advancing Visual Reasoning with Large Multimodal Models
item.description: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) have recently demonstrated remarkable visual understanding performance on both vision-language and vision-centric tasks.

item.title: Stationary MMD Points for Cubature
item.description: Approximation of a target probability distribution using a finite set of points is a problem of fundamental importance, arising in cubature, data compression, and optimisation.

item.title: Scaling External Knowledge Input Beyond Context Windows of LLMs via Multi-Agent Collaboration
item.description: However, the limited context window of LLMs obstructs scaling the amount of external knowledge input, prohibiting further improvement, especially for tasks requiring significant amount of external knowledge.

item.title: Dual-Polarization Stacked Intelligent Metasurfaces for Holographic MIMO
item.description: To address the limited wave domain signal processing capabilities of traditional single-polarized stacked intelligent metasurfaces (SIMs) in holographic multiple-input multiple-output (HMIMO) systems, which stems from limited integration space, this paper proposes a dual-polarized SIM (DPSIM) architecture.

item.title: Counterfactual Multi-player Bandits for Explainable Recommendation Diversification
item.description: Existing recommender systems tend to prioritize items closely aligned with users' historical interactions, inevitably trapping users in the dilemma of ``filter bubble''.

item.title: Taylor expansion-based Kolmogorov-Arnold network for blind image quality assessment
item.description: Kolmogorov-Arnold Network (KAN) has attracted growing interest for its strong function approximation capability.

item.title: Improved Representation Steering for Language Models
item.description: Steering methods for language models (LMs) seek to provide fine-grained and interpretable control over model generations by variously changing model inputs, weights, or representations to adjust behavior.

item.title: OVERT: A Benchmark for Over-Refusal Evaluation on Text-to-Image Models
item.description: Text-to-Image (T2I) models have achieved remarkable success in generating visual content from text inputs.

item.title: Cardiac Digital Twins at Scale from MRI: Open Tools and Representative Models from ~55000 UK Biobank Participants
item.description: A cardiac digital twin is a virtual replica of a patient's heart for screening, diagnosis, prognosis, risk assessment, and treatment planning of cardiovascular diseases.

item.title: DeSocial: Blockchain-based Decentralized Social Networks
item.description: Web 2. 0 social platforms are inherently centralized, with user data and algorithmic decisions controlled by the platform.

item.title: A domain adaptation neural network for digital twin-supported fault diagnosis
item.description: For example, applying DANN to a baseline CNN model improves its accuracy from 70. 00% to 80. 22% on real-world test data, demonstrating the effectiveness of domain adaptation in bridging the sim-to-real gap.

item.title: FastFace: Tuning Identity Preservation in Distilled Diffusion via Guidance and Attention
item.description: In latest years plethora of identity-preserving adapters for a personalized generation with diffusion models have been released.

item.title: RoBiS: Robust Binary Segmentation for High-Resolution Industrial Images
item.description: Robust unsupervised anomaly detection (AD) in real-world scenarios is an important task.

item.title: Learning Where to Learn: Training Distribution Selection for Provable OOD Performance
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization remains a fundamental challenge in machine learning.

item.title: FeatInv: Spatially resolved mapping from feature space to input space using conditional diffusion models
item.description: Internal representations are crucial for understanding deep neural networks, such as their properties and reasoning patterns, but remain difficult to interpret.

item.title: SageAttention2++: A More Efficient Implementation of SageAttention2
item.description: To further accelerate SageAttention2, we propose to utilize the faster instruction of FP8 Matmul accumulated in FP16.

item.title: MVP: Multi-source Voice Pathology detection
item.description: Voice disorders significantly impact patient quality of life, yet non-invasive automated diagnosis remains under-explored due to both the scarcity of pathological voice data, and the variability in recording sources.

item.title: Deep Active Inference Agents for Delayed and Long-Horizon Environments
item.description: With the recent success of world-model agents, which extend the core idea of model-based reinforcement learning by learning a differentiable model for sample-efficient control across diverse tasks, active inference (AIF) offers a complementary, neuroscience-grounded paradigm that unifies perception, learning, and action within a single probabilistic framework powered by a generative model.

item.title: An Empirical Study on Strong-Weak Model Collaboration for Repo-level Code Generation
item.description: We study cost-efficient collaboration between strong and weak language models for repository-level code generation, where the weak model handles simpler tasks at lower cost, and the most challenging tasks are delegated to the strong model.

item.title: ExAnte: A Benchmark for Ex-Ante Inference in Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) face significant challenges in ex-ante reasoning, where analysis, inference, or predictions must be made without access to information from future events.

item.title: FLAME-MoE: A Transparent End-to-End Research Platform for Mixture-of-Experts Language Models
item.description: Recent large language models such as Gemini-1. 5, DeepSeek-V3, and Llama-4 increasingly adopt Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architectures, which offer strong efficiency-performance trade-offs by activating only a fraction of the model per token.

item.title: DISCOVER: Automated Curricula for Sparse-Reward Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We argue that solving complex and high-dimensional tasks requires solving simpler tasks that are relevant to the target task.

item.title: MMPerspective: Do MLLMs Understand Perspective? A Comprehensive Benchmark for Perspective Perception, Reasoning, and Robustness
item.description: Understanding perspective is fundamental to human visual perception, yet the extent to which multimodal large language models (MLLMs) internalize perspective geometry remains unclear.

item.title: Alita: Generalist Agent Enabling Scalable Agentic Reasoning with Minimal Predefinition and Maximal Self-Evolution
item.description: For Maximal self-evolution, we enable the creativity of Alita by providing a suite of general-purpose components to autonomously construct, refine, and reuse external capabilities by generating task-related model context protocols (MCPs) from open source, which contributes to scalable agentic reasoning.

item.title: MineAnyBuild: Benchmarking Spatial Planning for Open-world AI Agents
item.description: In this work, we take a step further to build a comprehensive benchmark called MineAnyBuild, aiming to evaluate the spatial planning ability of open-world AI agents in the Minecraft game.

item.title: TrojanStego: Your Language Model Can Secretly Be A Steganographic Privacy Leaking Agent
item.description: As large language models (LLMs) become integrated into sensitive workflows, concerns grow over their potential to leak confidential information.

item.title: Learning Extrapolative Sequence Transformations from Markov Chains
item.description: Specifically, our approach uses selected states from Markov chains as a source of training data for an autoregressive model, which is then able to efficiently generate novel sequences that extrapolate along the sequence-level properties of interest.

item.title: Learning to Trust Bellman Updates: Selective State-Adaptive Regularization for Offline RL
item.description: Offline reinforcement learning (RL) aims to learn an effective policy from a static dataset.

item.title: Balancing Interference and Correlation in Spatial Experimental Designs: A Causal Graph Cut Approach
item.description: This paper focuses on the design of spatial experiments to optimize the amount of information derived from the experimental data and enhance the accuracy of the resulting causal effect estimator.

item.title: FinLoRA: Benchmarking LoRA Methods for Fine-Tuning LLMs on Financial Datasets
item.description: In this paper, we present the open-source FinLoRA project that benchmarks LoRA methods on both general and highly professional financial tasks.

item.title: VoiceStar: Robust Zero-Shot Autoregressive TTS with Duration Control and Extrapolation
item.description: CPM training also helps to mitigate the training/inference mismatch, and significantly improves the quality of the generated speech in terms of speaker similarity and intelligibility.

item.title: Beyond Freezing: Sparse Tuning Enhances Plasticity in Continual Learning with Pre-Trained Models
item.description: Continual Learning with Pre-trained Models holds great promise for efficient adaptation across sequential tasks.

item.title: Grokking ExPLAIND: Unifying Model, Data, and Training Attribution to Study Model Behavior
item.description: Post-hoc interpretability methods typically attribute a model's behavior to its components, data, or training trajectory in isolation.
